description:
This show provides the very basic computer literacy skills by providing a comprehensive and full range of entry-level computing skills by Dr. Tonny Omwansa. It is foundational for anyone looking to move any profession using computers on a daily basis because entry-level computing skills have become a compulsory requirement in business today.
Dr. Omwansa helps the learner to come up to speed on computing basics, and helps them achieve competency and skills on a computer easily. The show  covers everything from computer hardware and software to the underlying functionality of a computer, and helps readers gain the skills and knowledge they need to move forward in their careers, or to successfully prepare for any of the IC3 Exams.  The show covers the following objectives
•              Learn about computer hardware, software and other basic functions
•              Get a full introduction to Windows and Microsoft Office
•              Create polished documents and presentations in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word 2010
Gain an understanding of web basics, connectivity, security and privacy
name: IC3-I Choose Life
subtitle: Computing Fundamentals

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:05.304
[SOUND] Hello ITPRO TV welcomes you

2
00:00:05.304 --> 00:00:12.656
to a special series in
conduction with IC3 and

3
00:00:12.656 --> 00:00:18.509
I choose life that we find in Africa.

4
00:00:18.509 --> 00:00:22.585
And here to help us to understand the
content that we'll be covering is gonna be

5
00:00:22.585 --> 00:00:23.716
Dr. Tony Almuanza.

6
00:00:23.716 --> 00:00:28.320
Dr. Almuanza, welcome to our studios and
what are we gonna be taking look at?

7
00:00:28.320 --> 00:00:32.870
>> Thank you very much for inviting me
over here and it's a great place to be as

8
00:00:32.870 --> 00:00:38.550
I look around, technology here is powerful
And we're gonna spend sometime thinking

9
00:00:38.550 --> 00:00:43.380
through the fundamentals of computing,
that we can then use to learn and

10
00:00:43.380 --> 00:00:46.980
become more proficient and
improve our productivity.

11
00:00:46.980 --> 00:00:51.210
We're basically gonna spend time
thinking about four key areas.

12
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:54.820
And the four key areas are gonna
be the basics of computers.

13
00:00:54.820 --> 00:00:56.200
Thinking through the hardware.

14
00:00:56.200 --> 00:01:01.000
Thinking through the overall construction
of a computer which includes input output

15
00:01:01.000 --> 00:01:06.350
devices, the storage, the system unit and
broadly the basics of the computer.

16
00:01:06.350 --> 00:01:07.390
That's one element.

17
00:01:07.390 --> 00:01:10.950
The second element, we're gonna spend
a little bit of time on software.

18
00:01:10.950 --> 00:01:15.469
That's what runs the computer because
the computer on it's own is a hardware,

19
00:01:15.469 --> 00:01:17.770
really can't get to do much.

20
00:01:17.770 --> 00:01:18.800
So we need software.

21
00:01:18.800 --> 00:01:22.940
So we'll talk about the system software
which includes the operating system

22
00:01:22.940 --> 00:01:25.300
among other types of system software, and

23
00:01:25.300 --> 00:01:30.530
we'll pick up on a specific operating
system, which is the Windows 7.

24
00:01:30.530 --> 00:01:34.220
And then, we'll spend a bit of time
thinking about the administration of

25
00:01:34.220 --> 00:01:38.750
the same and maintenance of that
Windows 7 operating system.

26
00:01:38.750 --> 00:01:42.770
Then towards the end of that section we'll
spend time on application software and

27
00:01:42.770 --> 00:01:44.900
we'll look at what are some
of the features and

28
00:01:44.900 --> 00:01:47.470
characteristics of application software?

29
00:01:47.470 --> 00:01:51.310
The third thing we're gonna spend
time on is Microsoft Office.

30
00:01:51.310 --> 00:01:57.383
So we want to appreciate what is Microsoft
Office 2000, or 2010 or whatever?

31
00:01:57.383 --> 00:02:01.627
But we will spend a lot of
time on Microsoft Office 2010.

32
00:02:01.627 --> 00:02:04.648
Then we'll really master
ourselves a little more on

33
00:02:04.648 --> 00:02:07.876
thinking through Microsoft Word,
Microsoft Access,

34
00:02:07.876 --> 00:02:11.435
Microsoft PowerPoint, and
then Microsoft Excel.

35
00:02:11.435 --> 00:02:16.540
Then, I hope that that way we will have
built our capacity to use a computer and

36
00:02:16.540 --> 00:02:17.990
improve our productivity.

37
00:02:17.990 --> 00:02:22.990
Then we'll close with the fourth section
which will focus on connectivity and

38
00:02:22.990 --> 00:02:24.060
communication.

39
00:02:24.060 --> 00:02:29.070
In that area, we'll want to spend thinking
about how to compute this communicate,

40
00:02:29.070 --> 00:02:33.120
what are the basics of the Internet,
how does data flow around.

41
00:02:33.120 --> 00:02:37.130
How could we possibly create a website,
how do we access website and

42
00:02:37.130 --> 00:02:38.070
things like that.

43
00:02:38.070 --> 00:02:41.950
And then in conclusion of that section,
we wanna think about the safety of users,

44
00:02:41.950 --> 00:02:47.360
the safety of our computers,
the environmental issues,

45
00:02:47.360 --> 00:02:52.571
the legal issues, ethical issues, and
hopefully we'll have been empowered.

46
00:02:52.571 --> 00:02:53.079
>> All right.

47
00:02:53.079 --> 00:02:57.588
Well Dr. Almonza, thank you for
being here as we start this new series and

48
00:02:57.588 --> 00:03:02.210
we want to make sure that you
are actually going to enjoy this as well.

49
00:03:02.210 --> 00:03:06.510
So if you are ready for actually learning
more about computing fundamentals,

50
00:03:06.510 --> 00:03:10.240
you wanna stay right here as
we get started very soon.

51
00:03:10.240 --> 00:03:11.309
Thank you for joining us.

52
00:03:11.309 --> 00:03:17.345
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa explain the concept and components of information systems and some of the computer basic people need to understand when working and living in computer technology based societies and companies, respectively.  They discuss the personal computer, servers, mainframes and super computers and when people normally encounter them and use them.  This episode with Dr. Omwansa sets the first steps for digital literacy.
episodes.title: Computing Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa introduce the system unit.  They describe not only its function but also basic hardware components found within the system unit:  CPU, Memory, Motherboard, Power Supply.  Each is brief described and shown.  They discuss each component’s role in the system unit and its necessity.  Dr. Omwansa discusses not only the components but also their interworking together to make a functional computing system.
episodes.title: The System Unit

episodes.description: in this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa discuss how to select  input and output devices.  They discuss the importance of choosing the right devices for the right context and settings and even the right software applications.  They show and discuss the function of the most common input and out devices.  They also discuss some of the useful criteria in selecting the devices that will be used in our computing environment.
episodes.title: Input, Output and Storage

episodes.description: in this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa discuss how to select storage.  They discuss the importance of choosing the right devices for the right context and settings and even the right software applications.  They show and discuss conventional hard drives, solid state, usb flash drives and even external usb drives..  They also discuss some of the useful criteria in selecting the storage that we may purchase.
episodes.title: Input, Output and Storage Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa introduce the basic operating system concept.  They discuss the functions every operating system does for the user.  They also mention and describe some of the most common operating systems based on device types, such as smartphones and tablets, desktops, and servers.  They also mention that the operating systems tend to have utilities to help maintain the operating system functions.  Lastly, they talk about the basics of a file system and how it helps to organize file management and even allows us to use some of the operating system utilities functions like compression, encryption, file extension and searching utilities at the file level.
episodes.title: Operating System Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa take a tour of the windows 7 operating systems.  They highlight the desktop interface, the basics of the start menu, using file explorer and working with files in Windows 7.  They demonstrate and point out certain elements and how to navigate around to find files, create files and even delete files.  The emphasize the need for the user to be familiar with navigating the operating system.
episodes.title: Introduction to Windows 7

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa discuss the different tools used for administration and maintenance in Windows 7.  They show how to create user accounts and explain the difference between standard user accounts and administrative user accounts.  They also describe some of the parental features and file permission can be used to control access to applications, games and files, respectively. Dr. Omwansa also describes some of the maintenance tools built into windows.  They end the episode by describing basic operating system troubleshooting.
episodes.title: Windows 7 Administration and Maintenance

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa describe application software types computer users will normally use on a day by day basis.  They describe a few categories of software:  Business Productivity, Specialized software, and entertainment software.  Dr. Omwansa describe the usage of each category of software, emphasizing the business productivity software.
episodes.title: Understanding Application Software

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa describe the microsoft office 2010 productivity suite.  They emphasize nature of the user interface and it’s consistency across Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint and to an extent Microsoft Access.  Dr. Omwansa emphasizes this interface consistency will make it easier for users to learn the different products.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Office 2010

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa continue to demonstrate features of the common shared interface in Office 2010.  They emphasize that learning these features helps the user to feel confident that they control the Microsoft Office 2010 environment regardless of which product they are using.  They also show how to save and name files to a location to help them to reuse it later as well as how to print when needing a hard copy of their work.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Office Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa introduce the skills and techniques for getting started with Microsoft Word 2010.  They describe and show how to format text and paragraphs using the tools found in the ribbon to make an effective looking document.  Using the built in tools, they also show to working with larger documents and even with lists.  This episode is rounded out by Dr. Omwansa emphasizing the importance of learning to use Word with proper fundamentals rather than creating bad habits in learning the fundamentals.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Word 2010

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa continue to describe and demonstrate the skills and techniques for getting started with Microsoft Word 2010.  This time, they begin with page number and headers and footers and show how to work with larger documents that can be easily disorganized without using  the styles to format documents and sections.  Dr. Omwansa finishes the introduction by showing the use of comments and tracking changes.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Word Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa introduce the skills and techniques for getting started with Microsoft Excel 2010.  They show and describe working with workbooks and worksheets helping users to distinguish between them.  They also show how to navigate around the interface of Excel 2010 and selecting text in Excel.  Dr. Omwansa shows how to use the series fill feature to help with productivity.  They slow down when it comes to deleting the data from a cell because of the effect it will have on the surrounding data.  Lastly, they take a look at using Merge and Center to help logically segment the data in an easy and effective manner.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Excel 2010

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa continue with the skills and techniques for getting started with Microsoft Excel 2010.  They start with introducing numbering formats and explain the importance of them for receivers of the data and how to change the numbering format. Also they show how to add borders to cells and tables.  Dr. Omwansa also introduces users how to create a basic formula in excel and how to use the simple auto fill functions to produce some aggregate value.  Also in this episode, they show how to work with data tables and create charts for the data we have.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Excel 2010 Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonney Omwansa show how to get started with Microsoft Access 2010.  They describe why access is necessary and talk about the difference between a database and a spreadsheet.  Dr. Omwansa describes the concepts of Entity, Fields, Records.  According to the guys, these are basic terms that everyone must understand.  They also describe the logical connection between Entities (Tables) using primary key and foreign key (one to one or one to many relationships).  They conclude the segment by also mentioning forms and reports, along with the entities and relationships are the fundamentals of using Microsoft Access 2010.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Access

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa continue with the basics in Microsoft Access 2010.  They show and describe creating tables in design view and also how they can be created on the fly in spreadsheet view.  They discuss the importances of setting field properties and naming tables too.  They emphasize these are the structures that will house the data we will enter into our databases and so much be created with care before data entry occurs.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Access Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa continue more basics in Microsoft Access 2010.  They discuss and demonstrate the use of forms, reports and queries.  Dr. Omwansa discuss the nature of using forms and why it’s important when you have multiple tables within your Access database.  Also, they mention the purpose and show the creation of simple reports and forms using the built in Wizards available.   Lastly, they spend some time, discuss the the concept of querying an Access database using the wizard and the design view as well.  Each of these tools can be created easily and modified to present the user with the proper form, report and query without needing to learn programing.  They end the episode briefly emphasizing the importance of databases in our everyday life.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft Access Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonney Omwansa introduce us to the most intuitive of programs in the Microsoft Office Suite 2010, Powerpoint.  They help get the user started with using power point by showing the interface and the layout users will encounter.  They spend time describing how to enter objects and text into the presentation.  Also how to format that presentation using the individual tools and using themes that have been provided with Powerpoint.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft PowerPoint

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonney Omwansa continue to show how to get started with  Microsoft Office Powerpoint 2010.  They begin with introducing the need of using smart art in a presentation and how to create them for making logical connection with information.  Dr. Omwansa also introduce the use of animations in powerpoint presentation and gives a warning to use them sparingly.  Lastly, they talk about the idea that powerpoint shouldn’t be the focus of the presentation but a complement to the presentation.  Dr. Omwansa provides a few points to help the beginning presenter become a more effective presenter.
episodes.title: Introduction to Microsoft PowerPoint Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa describe basic networking concepts and explain different network terminology.  They discuss the classification of networks by geography and type.  They also talk about the basic networking hardware and some of the different technologies used to connect to the internet.  Dr. Omwansa also points out that connectivity issues may also exist but users can use some simple troubleshooting methods.
episodes.title: Network and Internet Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa talk about the basic functionality used on the internet.  Even though the internet provide the media and servers for the internet, Dr. Omwansa describes some of the most common forms of communication on the internet.  They describe communication in two broad categories: Asynchronous Communications and Synchronous (Near Synchronous) communication.  Email, social networking, forums and blogs are considered asynchronous communications; VoIP, Instant Messaging and Video conferencing would be considered synchronous or near synchronous communications, according to the team.  They also talk about using appropriate communication in a business setting and personal setting. They end the episode by taking a brief look at using an email application.
episodes.title: Online Communication

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa discuss the foundation of the world wide web: They describe where web information is stored, how to access it and what is normally retrieved when viewing a web page.  They describe the components used:  Web servers, Web browsers and Web pages.  Also, they show to access a web page by using a browser and knowing the URL (Uniform Resource Locator) and IP address.   Dr. Omwansa also demonstrates how to use a search engine’s power to find web pages that you do not know the exact URL to locate it.
episodes.title: Web Basics

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Dr. Tonny Omwansa discuss some of the fundamental security goals, concerns and methods that computer users must be aware of in a computer based job.  Dr. Omwansa describes the most common terminology and concepts.  They also discuss some of the most common threats and attacks used against computer systems that can affect a user.  They also shed some light into securing data and even strategies about making our computing safer.
episodes.title: Network Internet Privacy and Security
Legal, Health, Environment and Ethical Issues
